column4: HI, I'm trying to extract a tar.gz file to my root directory, what would be the syntax for that?
HI, I'm trying to extract a tar.gz file to my root directory, what would be the syntax for that?
Please can someone tell me how to extract a tar.gz file to a directory through terminal?
hold on
thanks
tar -xvzf <filename>.tar.gz
how would I send the file to root?
Do you know how to make it so it extracts to root?
you mean to /root ?
man tar
I mean so that the tar goes to the dir "/"
why do you want to extract something there ?
extract it and move it afterwards
it is a download that requires to go to that folder
I cant, it says I dont have permission
sudo tar -xvzf <filename>.tar.gz  /
ok
no garranties
tar: /: Not found in archive
tar: Error exit delayed from previous errors
jsut extract it and then move it     sudo mv /patth/   /
ok
http://www.linuxcommand.org/index.php
